  len <- min(nrow(x), 200)
  x[1:len, , drop = FALSE] |>
    kbl(digits = 2, align = "l", booktabs = TRUE) |>
    kable_styling(fixed_thead = TRUE) |>
    kable_paper("striped", full_width = TRUE, html_font = "Helvetica", font_size = 12) |>

    scroll_box(width = "700px", height = "500px") |>
    asis_output()
}

# Overview of My First Homework

In this assignment, I am expected to complete a text manipulation task using R and apply simple Markdown styling.

## Task Description

1. I create a string containing the text:

   >* Mary had a little lamb

2. I split the string so that each word appears on its own row.

3. I add a variable called **`Nletters`** that counts the number of letters in each word.

4. I apply custom styling using CSS to personalize the Markdown output.

---

# Code: Create the string

```{r}
text <- "Mary had a little lamb"
print(text)
```

# Split into individual words

```{r}
words <- unlist(strsplit(text, " "))
print(words)
```

# Create a data frame with letter counts

```{r}
marydf <- data.frame(
  word = words,
  Nletters = nchar(words)
)


knitr::kable(marydf, 
             caption = "Words and Letter Counts",
             format = "html") |>
  kableExtra::kable_styling() |>
  kableExtra::column_spec(1:2, bold = F)
```
